resources.string: MAGE provides mobile situational awareness capabilities. The MAGE app on your mobile device allows you to create geotagged field reports that contain media such as photos, videos, and voice recordings and share them instantly with who you want. Using the GPS in your mobile device, MAGE can also track users locations in real time. Your locations can be automatically shared with the other members of your team.\n\nThe app remains functional if your mobile device loses its network connection, and will upload its local content when a connection is re-established. When disconnected from the network, MAGE will use local data layers to continue to provide relevant GEOINT. Data layers, including map tiles and vector data, can be stored on your mobile device and are available at all times.

Your account has been created but it is not active. Please contact your MAGE administrator to activate your account before you can log in.

Sorry, there looks to be an unknown issue with your account, please contact your MAGE administrator for assistance.
Do not filter observations on time.
Do not filter locations on time.
You were logged in as %s, and your MAGE session has expired. Please login to resume using MAGE.

resources.string: Click to configure GPS sensitive and tracking options
MAGE location services have been disabled. Click here to go to settings and enabled the location permission
You are not a member of the current event. You cannot create observations in this event.
You are not a member of the current event. You cannot edit this observation.
You are not a member of the current event. You cannot report your location in this event.
The device has not received a location yet. To make an observation manually, long press on the map.
You are currently using coarse location which limits your location accuracy to several kilometers. Would you like to allow MAGE to access your precise location?
You are currently using coarse location which limits your location accuracy to several kilometers. Would you like to allow MAGE to access your precise location? This can be toggled in settings.

MAGE does not have access to your device location. To create observations at your current location, go to your device settings and enable the Location permission. You can also long press on the map at the desired location.
MAGE does not have access to your device location. To report your location, go to your device settings and enable the Location permission.
MAGE does not have access to your device location. To zoom to your location, go to your device settings and enable the Location permission.
MAGE does not have access to your device location. To get directions from your location, go to your device settings and enable the Location permission.
Would you like to display your heading on the map? This can be toggled in settings.
MAGE is looking for offline maps that may reside in external storage on your device. Please allow MAGE to access external media to view this map.
MAGE has been denied access to external storage. To access map caches that reside in external storage please go into the MAGE application settings on your device and enable the Storage permission.
MAGE has been denied access to the camera. To use the camera please go into the MAGE application settings on your device and enable the Camera and Storage permissions.
MAGE has been denied access to the microphone. To create audio files please go into the MAGE application settings on your device and enable the Microphone permission.
MAGE has been denied access to your location. Please go into the MAGE application settings on your device and enable the Location permission.
MAGE has been denied the notifications permission. If you would like to enable this please go to the MAGE application settings on your device and enable notifications.
Event administrators can add layers to your event, or can be shared from other applications.
You are about to delete the selected data and logout.\n\n Are you sure you want to do this?
Event administrators can add layers to your event.

Long click map to add next point
Drag and release to adjust location

Polygon must have at least three points
Location reporting for this MAGE server is disabled.
You are now reporting your location
You are no longer reporting your location
The file type %1$s is not supported by MAGE. Try uploading a .zip version of the file instead.
What type of observation would you like to create?
You are part of multiple events. The observations you create and your reported location will be part of the selected event.
You must be a member of at least one event to use MAGE. Ask your administrator to add you to an event.
Data fetching is turned off. Turn on data fetching to configure options.
MAGE Location services are turned off. Please update the application permissions for MAGE to allow the \'Location\' permission.
Choose a new profile photo from your gallery.
Take a new profile photo with your camera.
The first form in this list is the primary form, which determines how MAGE displays the observation on the map and in the feed. The forms will be displayed as ordered in all other views.
No users have reported their location within your configured time filter for this event.
No observations have been submitted within your configured time filter for this event.
Are you sure you want to remove the important flag from this observation?
Change important description for this observation
Remove important flag for this observation
An Error Has Occurred Please Contact Your Server Administrator or Try the Server URL Again
MAGE is a platform for marking and sharing geospatial data points (referred to as Observations) amongst various users tied to an Event. Observations can be captured as points, lines and polygons:

The MAGE Android app requires a publicly available MAGE web server instance in which to connect to. Once your MAGE server is running, enter your MAGE server\'s domain into the app and follow the login instructions. You can find instructions for configuring a MAGE web server instance here:

Before users can begin viewing or adding Observations, they must first be assigned to an Event. All Observations added by these users will be created in the context of that Event. You will use the MAGE web app to create an Event and assign users to it:
You can create new users using the MAGE web app or the native app:
Once you have a username and password, and you\'ve entered the domain of your server into the app, you can log into the app:
After successful login you will have the opportunity to select which Event you want to load if your userId is assigned to multiple Events. You can only view and interact with one Event at a time:
When the Event is first loaded, any pre-existing Observations tied to the Event will be pulled from the MAGE server and displayed on the map:
By default only Observations added within the last 30 days will be shown on the map, but you can change this behavior using the time filter option by clicking the filter icon at the top right.
The server will be periodically polled for new Observations. You can configure this polling frequency by selecting Settings -> Data Fetching -> Observations.

You can create new Observations by selecting the orange cross icon at the bottom right, or by long-pressing the map. The Observation type will default to a point. If the orange cross icon was used, the point will be centered at the device\'s present location. If long-press was used, the point will be centered where you long-pressed. If you would like to add a different Observation type other than point, tap the location bar on the \'Create Observation\' page to be presented with other options:

The options for Observation types include point, line, and polygon. You can change the shapes of lines and polygons by long-pressing on the map to draw a line to the point you long-pressed. The \'plus\' icons at the line vertices can be long-pressed to move their location as desired:

Once you have saved an Observation it will be synced to the MAGE server based on the intervals that have been set under the \'Data Fetching\' setting. You can check the sync status by navigating to the Observations list (click Observations from the bottom tab), and tapping the Observation of interest. If the Observation was successfully synced, the time of the push will be displayed at the top:
